titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Joseph Frost, Indictment
CWG7497

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Fayette CIRCUIT COURT,
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
AGAINST
Joseph Frost

THE GRAND JURY of Fayette county, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Joseph Frost of the committed as follows, viz: The said Joseph Frost on the 1st day of November 18625 in the county aforesaid, Did unlawfully receive one Sorrel Mare the personal property of Theophilus Baley knowing at the time that said Mare was stolen against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

WITNESSES:
Elijah Foley,
Jim Smith,
Al Cooper,
Will Cooper,
John Lyle,
W M Garrett,

Gus Frost,
Theop Baley,
E J Curley. } Scott,
a true Copy -- Att Jno B Norton c f c c

Comth Kentucky
vs. } Copy Indict (No 2.)
Frost Joseph

A true Bill.
Geo W Sutton, Foreman

Returned into Court Nov 4th 1865.
att Jno B Norton C
